field.name: STIMENA
field.description: For bit STIMENA[n], in register ITM_TERx: 0 = Stimulus port (32x + n) disabled 1 = Stimulus port (32x + n) enabled

field.name: PRIVMASK
field.description: Bit mask to enable tracing on ITM stimulus ports: Bit [0] = stimulus port [7:0] Bit [1] = stimulus port [15:8] Bit [2] = stimulus port [23:16] Bit [3] = stimulus port [31:24]

enumeratedValue.name: SWOENA_0
enumeratedValue.description: Timestamp counter uses the processor system clock.

enumeratedValue.name: SWOENA_1
enumeratedValue.description: Timestamp counter uses asynchronous clock from the TPIU interface.

field.name: TSPrescale
field.description: Local timestamp prescaler, used with the trace packet reference clock.

field.name: GTSFREQ
field.description: Global timestamp frequency. Defines how often the ITM generates a global timestamp, based on the global timestamp clock frequency, or disables generation of global timestamps.

enumeratedValue.name: GTSFREQ_1
enumeratedValue.description: Generate timestamp request whenever the ITM detects a change in global timestamp counter bits [47:7]. This is approximately every 128 cycles.

enumeratedValue.name: GTSFREQ_2
enumeratedValue.description: Generate timestamp request whenever the ITM detects a change in global timestamp counter bits [47:13]. This is approximately every 8192 cycles.

enumeratedValue.name: GTSFREQ_3
enumeratedValue.description: Generate a timestamp after every packet, if the output FIFO is empty.

field.name: TraceBusID
field.description: Identifier for multi-source trace stream formatting. If multi-source trace is in use, the debugger must write a non-zero value to this field.

field.name: BUSY
field.description: Indicates whether the ITM is currently processing events: 0: ITM is not processing any events. 1: ITM events present and being drained.

enumeratedValue.name: BUSY_0
enumeratedValue.description: ITM is not processing any events.

enumeratedValue.name: BUSY_1
enumeratedValue.description: ITM events present and beeing drained.

field.name: WriteAccessCode
field.description: Write Access Code. A write of 0xC5ACCE55 enables further write access to this device. An invalid write will have the affect of removing write access.

field.name: IMP
field.description: Lock mechanism is implemented. This bit always reads 1.

field.name: STATUS
field.description: Lock Status. This bit is HIGH when the device is locked, and LOW when unlocked.

field.name: s8BIT
field.description: Access Lock Register size. This bit reads 0 to indicate a 32-bit register is present.

enumeratedValue.name: ComponentClass_15
enumeratedValue.description: PrimeCell of system component with no standardized register layout, for backward compatibility.

field.name: DISDEFWBUF
field.description: Disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses.

enumeratedValue.name: RETTOBASE_0
enumeratedValue.description: there are preempted active exceptions to execute

enumeratedValue.name: RETTOBASE_1
enumeratedValue.description: there are no active exceptions, or the currently-executing exception is the only active exception

field.name: VECTPENDING
field.description: Exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

enumeratedValue.name: PENDSTCLR_1
enumeratedValue.description: removes the pending state from the SysTick exception

enumeratedValue.name: PENDSTSET_0
enumeratedValue.description: write: no effect; read: SysTick exception is not pending

enumeratedValue.name: PENDSTSET_1
enumeratedValue.description: write: changes SysTick exception state to pending; read: SysTick exception is pending

enumeratedValue.name: PENDSVCLR_1
enumeratedValue.description: removes the pending state from the PendSV exception

enumeratedValue.name: PENDSVSET_0
enumeratedValue.description: write: no effect; read: PendSV exception is not pending

enumeratedValue.name: PENDSVSET_1
enumeratedValue.description: write: changes PendSV exception state to pending; read: PendSV exception is pending

enumeratedValue.name: NMIPENDSET_0
enumeratedValue.description: write: no effect; read: NMI exception is not pending

enumeratedValue.name: NMIPENDSET_1
enumeratedValue.description: write: changes NMI exception state to pending; read: NMI exception is pending

register.name: AIRCR
register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

enumeratedValue.name: SYSRESETREQ_1
enumeratedValue.description: asserts a signal to the outer system that requests a reset

field.name: PRIGROUP
field.description: Interrupt priority grouping field. This field determines the split of group priority from subpriority.

enumeratedValue.name: SLEEPONEXIT_0
enumeratedValue.description: o not sleep when returning to Thread mode

enumeratedValue.name: SLEEPONEXIT_1
enumeratedValue.description: enter sleep, or deep sleep, on return from an ISR

enumeratedValue.name: SEVONPEND_0
enumeratedValue.description: only enabled interrupts or events can wakeup the processor, disabled interrupts are excluded

enumeratedValue.name: SEVONPEND_1
enumeratedValue.description: enabled events and all interrupts, including disabled interrupts, can wakeup the processor

enumeratedValue.name: NONBASETHRDENA_0
enumeratedValue.description: processor can enter Thread mode only when no exception is active

enumeratedValue.name: NONBASETHRDENA_1
enumeratedValue.description: processor can enter Thread mode from any level under the control of an EXC_RETURN value

field.name: USERSETMPEND
field.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the STIR

enumeratedValue.name: UNALIGN_TRP_0
enumeratedValue.description: do not trap unaligned halfword and word accesses

enumeratedValue.name: UNALIGN_TRP_1
enumeratedValue.description: trap unaligned halfword and word accesses

field.name: DIV_0_TRP
field.description: Enables faulting or halting when the processor executes an SDIV or UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

field.name: BFHFNMIGN
field.description: Enables handlers with priority -1 or -2 to ignore data BusFaults caused by load and store instructions.

enumeratedValue.name: BFHFNMIGN_0
enumeratedValue.description: data bus faults caused by load and store instructions cause a lock-up

enumeratedValue.name: BFHFNMIGN_1
enumeratedValue.description: handlers running at priority -1 and -2 ignore data bus faults caused by load and store instructions

field.name: STKALIGN
field.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

field.name: PRI_15
field.description: Priority of system handler 15, SysTick exception

register.name: SHCSR
register.description: System Handler Control and State Register

enumeratedValue.name: IACCVIOL_1
enumeratedValue.description: the processor attempted an instruction fetch from a location that does not permit execution

enumeratedValue.name: DACCVIOL_1
enumeratedValue.description: the processor attempted a load or store at a location that does not permit the operation

enumeratedValue.name: MUNSTKERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: unstack for an exception return has caused one or more access violations

enumeratedValue.name: MSTKERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: stacking for an exception entry has caused one or more access violations

enumeratedValue.name: MLSPERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: No MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

enumeratedValue.name: MLSPERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: A MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

enumeratedValue.name: MMARVALID_0
enumeratedValue.description: value in MMAR is not a valid fault address

enumeratedValue.name: MMARVALID_1
enumeratedValue.description: MMAR holds a valid fault address

enumeratedValue.name: PRECISERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: a data bus error has occurred, and the PC value stacked for the exception return points to the instruction that caused the fault

enumeratedValue.name: IMPRECISERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: a data bus error has occurred, but the return address in the stack frame is not related to the instruction that caused the error

enumeratedValue.name: UNSTKERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: unstack for an exception return has caused one or more BusFaults

enumeratedValue.name: STKERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: stacking for an exception entry has caused one or more BusFaults

enumeratedValue.name: LSPERR_0
enumeratedValue.description: No bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

enumeratedValue.name: LSPERR_1
enumeratedValue.description: A bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

enumeratedValue.name: BFARVALID_0
enumeratedValue.description: value in BFAR is not a valid fault address

enumeratedValue.name: BFARVALID_1
enumeratedValue.description: BFAR holds a valid fault address

enumeratedValue.name: UNDEFINSTR_1
enumeratedValue.description: the processor has attempted to execute an undefined instruction

enumeratedValue.name: INVSTATE_1
enumeratedValue.description: the processor has attempted to execute an instruction that makes illegal use of the EPSR

enumeratedValue.name: INVPC_1
enumeratedValue.description: the processor has attempted an illegal load of EXC_RETURN to the PC

enumeratedValue.name: NOCP_0
enumeratedValue.description: no UsageFault caused by attempting to access a coprocessor

enumeratedValue.name: NOCP_1
enumeratedValue.description: the processor has attempted to access a coprocessor

enumeratedValue.name: UNALIGNED_0
enumeratedValue.description: no unaligned access fault, or unaligned access trapping not enabled

enumeratedValue.name: UNALIGNED_1
enumeratedValue.description: the processor has made an unaligned memory access

enumeratedValue.name: DIVBYZERO_0
enumeratedValue.description: no divide by zero fault, or divide by zero trapping not enabled

enumeratedValue.name: DIVBYZERO_1
enumeratedValue.description: the processor has executed an SDIV or UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

enumeratedValue.name: VECTTBL_0
enumeratedValue.description: no BusFault on vector table read

enumeratedValue.name: HALTED_0
enumeratedValue.description: No active halt request debug event

enumeratedValue.name: BKPT_1
enumeratedValue.description: At least one current breakpoint debug event

enumeratedValue.name: DWTTRAP_0
enumeratedValue.description: No current debug events generated by the DWT

enumeratedValue.name: DWTTRAP_1
enumeratedValue.description: At least one current debug event generated by the DWT

field.name: AUXFAULT
field.description: Latched version of the AUXFAULT inputs

enumeratedValue.name: CP10_0
enumeratedValue.description: Access denied. Any attempted access generates a NOCP UsageFault

enumeratedValue.name: CP10_1
enumeratedValue.description: Privileged access only. An unprivileged access generates a NOCP fault.

enumeratedValue.name: CP11_0
enumeratedValue.description: Access denied. Any attempted access generates a NOCP UsageFault

enumeratedValue.name: CP11_1
enumeratedValue.description: Privileged access only. An unprivileged access generates a NOCP fault.

enumeratedValue.name: LSPACT_0
enumeratedValue.description: Lazy state preservation is not active.

enumeratedValue.name: LSPACT_1
enumeratedValue.description: Lazy state preservation is active. floating-point stack frame has been allocated but saving state to it has been deferred.

field.name: USER
field.description: Privilege level when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: USER_0
enumeratedValue.description: Privilege level was not user when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: USER_1
enumeratedValue.description: Privilege level was user when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

field.name: THREAD
field.description: Mode when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: THREAD_0
enumeratedValue.description: Mode was not Thread Mode when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: THREAD_1
enumeratedValue.description: Mode was Thread Mode when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

field.name: HFRDY
field.description: Permission to set the HardFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: HFRDY_0
enumeratedValue.description: Priority did not permit setting the HardFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: HFRDY_1
enumeratedValue.description: Priority permitted setting the HardFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

field.name: MMRDY
field.description: Permission to set the MemManage handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: MMRDY_0
enumeratedValue.description: MemManage is disabled or priority did not permit setting the MemManage handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: MMRDY_1
enumeratedValue.description: MemManage is enabled and priority permitted setting the MemManage handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

field.name: BFRDY
field.description: Permission to set the BusFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: BFRDY_0
enumeratedValue.description: BusFault is disabled or priority did not permit setting the BusFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: BFRDY_1
enumeratedValue.description: BusFault is disabled or priority did not permit setting the BusFault handler to the pending state when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

field.name: MONRDY
field.description: Permission to set the MON_PEND when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: MONRDY_0
enumeratedValue.description: DebugMonitor is disabled or priority did not permit setting MON_PEND when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

enumeratedValue.name: MONRDY_1
enumeratedValue.description: DebugMonitor is enabled and priority permits setting MON_PEND when the floating-point stack frame was allocated.

field.name: LSPEN
field.description: Lazy state preservation for floating-point context.

enumeratedValue.name: LSPEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disable automatic lazy state preservation for floating-point context.

enumeratedValue.name: LSPEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enable automatic lazy state preservation for floating-point context.

field.name: ASPEN
field.description: Enables CONTROL2 setting on execution of a floating-point instruction. This results in automatic hardware state preservation and restoration, for floating-point context, on exception entry and exit.

enumeratedValue.name: ASPEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: Disable CONTROL2 setting on execution of a floating-point instruction.

enumeratedValue.name: ASPEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Enable CONTROL2 setting on execution of a floating-point instruction.

field.name: ADDRESS
field.description: The location of the unpopulated floating-point register space allocated on an exception stack frame.

field.name: RMode
field.description: Default value for FPSCR.RMode (Rounding Mode control field).

field.name: FZ
field.description: Default value for FPSCR.FZ (Flush-to-zero mode control bit).

enumeratedValue.name: FZ_0
enumeratedValue.description: Flush-to-zero mode disabled. Behavior of the floating-point system is fully compliant with the IEEE 754 standard.

field.name: DN
field.description: Default value for FPSCR.DN (Default NaN mode control bit).

enumeratedValue.name: DN_0
enumeratedValue.description: NaN operands propagate through to the output of a floating-point operation.

enumeratedValue.name: DN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Any operation involving one or more NaNs returns the Default NaN.

field.name: AHP
field.description: Default value for FPSCR.AHP (Alternative half-precision control bit).

enumeratedValue.name: TICKINT_0
enumeratedValue.description: counting down to 0 does not assert the SysTick exception request

enumeratedValue.name: TICKINT_1
enumeratedValue.description: counting down to 0 asserts the SysTick exception request

field.name: RELOAD
field.description: Value to load into the SysTick Current Value Register when the counter reaches 0

field.name: CURRENT
field.description: Current value at the time the register is accessed

field.name: TENMS
field.description: Reload value to use for 10ms timing

enumeratedValue.name: SKEW_1
enumeratedValue.description: 10ms calibration value is inexact, because of the clock frequency

enumeratedValue.name: NOREF_1
enumeratedValue.description: The reference clock is not provided

field.name: INTID
field.description: Interrupt ID of the interrupt to trigger, in the range 0-239. For example, a value of 0x03 specifies interrupt IRQ3.

field.name: ETMPD
field.description: ETM power down. This bit can be used by an implementation to control if the ETM is in a low power state. This bit must be cleared by the trace software tools at the beginning of a debug session. When this bit is set to 1, writes to some registers and fields might be ignored.

field.name: PS
field.description: Port size. The ETM-M4 has no influence over the external pins used for trace. These bits are implemented but not used. On an ETM reset these bits reset to 0b001.

field.name: SP
field.description: Stall processor. The FIFOFULL output can be used to stall the processor to prevent overflow. The FIFOFULL output is only enabled when the stall processor bit is set to 1. When the bit is 0 the FIFOFULL output remains LOW at all times and the FIFO overflows if there are too many trace packets. Trace resumes without corruption once the FIFO has drained, if overflow does occur. An ETM reset sets this bit to 0.

field.name: BO
field.description: Branch output. When set to 1 all branch addresses are output, even if the branch was because of a direct branch instruction. Setting this bit enables reconstruction of the program flow without having access to the memory image of the code being executed. When this bit is set to 1, more trace data is generated, and this may affect the performance of the trace system. Information about the execution of a branch is traced regardless of the state of this bit. An ETM reset sets this bit to 0.

field.name: DRC
field.description: Debug request control. When set to 1 and the trigger event occurs, the DBGRQ output is asserted until DBGACK is observed. This enables the ARM processor to be forced into Debug state. An ETM reset sets this bit to 0.

field.name: ETMP
field.description: ETM programming. This bit must be set to 1 at the start of the ETM programming sequence. Tracing is prevented while this bit is set to 1. On an ETM reset this bit is set to b1.

field.name: ETMPS
field.description: ETM port selection. This bit can be used to control other trace components in an implementation. This bit must be set by the trace software tools to ensure that trace output is enabled from this ETM. An ETM reset sets this bit to 0.

field.name: PM2
field.description: This bit is implemented but has no function. An ETM reset sets this bit to 0.

field.name: PM
field.description: These bits are implemented but have no function. An ETM reset sets these bits to 0.

field.name: PS3
field.description: This bit is implemented but has no function. An ETM reset sets this bit to 0.

field.name: TE
field.description: When set, this bit enables timestamping. An ETM reset sets this bit to 0.

field.name: NumberOfAddressComparatorPairs
field.description: Number of address comparator pairs. The value of these bits is b0000, indicating that address comparator pairs are not implemented.

field.name: NDVC
field.description: Number of data value comparators. The value of these bits is b0000, indicating that data value comparators are not implemented.

field.name: NMMD
field.description: Number of memory map decoders. The value of these bits is b00000, indicating that memory map decoder inputs are not implemented.

field.name: NC
field.description: Number of counters. The value of these bits is b001, indicating that one counter is implemented.

field.name: SP
field.description: Sequencer present. The value of this bit is 0, indicating that the sequencer is not implemented.

field.name: NEI
field.description: Number of external inputs. The value of these bits is between b000 and b010, indicating the number of external inputs, from 0 to 2, implemented in the system.

field.name: NEO
field.description: Number of external outputs. The value of these bits is b000, indicating that no external outputs are supported.

field.name: FFLP
field.description: FIFOFULL logic present. The value of this bit is 1, indicating that FIFOFULL logic is present in the ETM. To use FIFOFULL the system must also support the function, as indicated by bit [8] of ETMSCR.

field.name: NCIDC
field.description: Number of Context ID comparators. The value of these bits is b00, indicating that Context ID comparators are not implemented.

field.name: TSSBP
field.description: Trace start/stop block present. The value of this bit is 1, indicating that the Trace start/stop block is present.

field.name: CMA
field.description: Coprocessor and memory access. The value of this bit is 1, indicating that memory-mapped access to registers is supported.

field.name: ETMIDRP
field.description: The value of this bit is 1, indicating that the ETMIDR, register 0x79, is present and defines the ETM architecture version in use.

field.name: UOF
field.description: Untraced overflow flag. If set to 1, there is an overflow that has not yet been traced. This bit is cleared to 0 when either: - trace is restarted - the ETM Power Down bit, bit [0] of the ETM Control Register, 0x00, is set to 1. Note: Setting or clearing the ETM programming bit does not cause this bit to be cleared to 0.

field.name: Progbit
field.description: ETM programming bit value (Progbit). The current effective value of the ETM Programming bit (ETM Control Register bit [10]). Tou must wait for this bit to go to 1 before you start to program the ETM.

field.name: Status
field.description: Holds the current status of the trace start/stop resource. If set to 1, it indicates that a trace on address has been matched, without a corresponding trace off address match.

field.name: Trigger
field.description: Trigger bit. Set when the trigger occurs, and prevents the trigger from being output until the ETM is next programmed.

field.name: MaximumPortSize
field.description: Maximum ETM port size bits [2:0]. These bits are used in conjunction with bit [9]. The value of these bits is b001.

field.name: FIFOFULLsupported
field.description: FIFOFULL supported. The value of this bit is 1, indicating that FIFOFULL is supported. This bit is used in conjunction with bit [23] of the ETMCCR.

field.name: MaximumPortSize3
field.description: Maximum ETM port size bit [3]. This bit is used in conjunction with bits [2:0]. Its value is 0. This has no effect on the TPIU trace port.

field.name: PortSizeSupported
field.description: Port size supported. This bit reads as 1 if the currently selected port size is supported. This has no effect on the TPIU trace port.

field.name: PortModeSupported
field.description: Port mode supported. This bit reads as 1 if the currently selected port mode is supported. This has no effect on the TPIU trace port.

field.name: N
field.description: These bits give the number of supported processors minus 1. The value of these bits is b000, indicating that there is only one processor connected.

field.name: NoFetchComparisons
field.description: No Fetch comparisons. The value of this bit is 1, indicating that fetch comparisons are not implemented.

field.name: TraceControlEnable
field.description: Trace start/stop enable. The trace start/stop resource, resource 0x5F, is unaffected by the value of this bit.

enumeratedValue.name: TraceControlEnable_0
enumeratedValue.description: Tracing is unaffected by the trace start/stop logic.

enumeratedValue.name: TraceControlEnable_1
enumeratedValue.description: Tracing is controlled by the trace on and off addresses configured for the trace start/stop logic.

field.name: FIFOFullLevel
field.description: FIFO full level. The number of bytes left in FIFO, below which the FIFOFULL or SupressData signal is asserted. For example, setting this value to 15 causes data trace suppression or processor stalling, if enabled, when there are less than 15 free bytes in the FIFO.

field.name: ImplementationRevision
field.description: Implementation revision. The value of these bits is b0000, indicating implementation revision, 0.

field.name: MinorETMarchitectureVersion
field.description: Minor ETM architecture version. The value of these bits is 0b0101, indicating minor architecture version number 5.

field.name: MajorETMarchitectureVersion
field.description: Major ETM architecture version. The value of these bits is 0b0010, indicating major architecture version number 3, ETMv3.

field.name: ProcessorFamily
field.description: Processor family. The value of these bits is 0b1111, indicating that the processor family is not identified in this register.

field.name: LoadPCfirst
field.description: Load PC first. The value of this bit is 0, indicating that data tracing is not supported.

field.name: ThumbInstructionTracing
field.description: 32-bit Thumb instruction tracing. The value of this bit is 1, indicating that a 32-bit Thumb instruction is traced as a single instruction.

enumeratedValue.name: ThumbInstructionTracing_0
enumeratedValue.description: A 32-bit Thumb instruction is traced as two instructions, and exceptions might occur between these two instructions.

enumeratedValue.name: ThumbInstructionTracing_1
enumeratedValue.description: A 32-bit Thimb instruction is traced as a single instruction.

field.name: SecurityExtensionSupport
field.description: Security Extensions support. The value of this bit is 0, indicating that the ETM behaves as if the processor is in Secure state at all times.

enumeratedValue.name: SecurityExtensionSupport_0
enumeratedValue.description: The ETM behaves as if the processor is in Secure state at all times.

enumeratedValue.name: SecurityExtensionSupport_1
enumeratedValue.description: The ARM architecture Security Extensions are implemented by the processor.

field.name: BranchPacketEncoding
field.description: Branch packet encoding. The value of this bit is 1, indicating that alternative branch packet encoding is implemented.

enumeratedValue.name: BranchPacketEncoding_0
enumeratedValue.description: The ETM implements the original branch packet encoding.

enumeratedValue.name: BranchPacketEncoding_1
enumeratedValue.description: The ETM implements the alternative branch packet encoding.

field.name: ImplementorCode
field.description: Implementor code. These bits identify ARM as the implementor of the processor. The value of these bits is 01000001.

field.name: ExtendedExternalInputSelectors
field.description: Extended external input selectors. The value of these bits is 0, indicating that extended external input selectors are not implemented.

field.name: ExtendedExternalInputBus
field.description: Extended external input bus. The value of these bits is 0, indicating that the extended external input bus is not implemented.

field.name: ReadableRegisters
field.description: Readable registers. The value of this bit is 1, indicating that all registers are readable.

field.name: DataAddressComparisons
field.description: Data address comparisons. The value of this bit is 1, indicating that data address comparisons are not supported.

field.name: InstrumentationResources
field.description: Instrumentation resources. The value of these bits is 0b000, indicating that no Instrumentation resources are supported.

field.name: EmbeddedICEwatchpointInputs
field.description: EmbeddedICE watchpoint inputs. The value of these bits is 0b0100, indicating that the number of EmbeddedICE watchpoint inputs implemented is four. These inputs come from the DWT.

field.name: TraceStartStopBlockUsesEmbeddedICEwatchpointInputs
field.description: Trace Start/Stop block uses EmbeddedICE watchpoint inputs. The value of this bit is 1, indicating that the Trace Start/Stop block uses the EmbeddedICE watchpoint inputs.

field.name: EmbeddedICEbehaviorControlImplemented
field.description: EmbeddedICE behavior control implemented. The value of this bit is 0, indicating that the ETMEIBCR is not implemented.

field.name: TimestampingImplemented
field.description: Timestamping implemented. This bit is set to 1, indicating that timestamping is implemented.

field.name: ReducedFunctionCounter
field.description: Reduced function counter. Set to 1 to indicate that Counter 1 is a reduced function counter.

field.name: TimestampEncoding
field.description: Timestamp encoding. Set to 1 to indicate that the timestamp is encoded as a natural binary number.

field.name: TimestampSize
field.description: Timestamp size. Set to 0 to indicate a size of 48 bits.

field.name: StartResourceSelection
field.description: Start resource selection. Setting any of these bits to 1 selects the corresponding EmbeddedICE watchpoint input as a TraceEnable start resource. Bit [0] corresponds to input 1, bit [1] corresponds to input 2, bit [2] corresponds to input 3, and bit [3] corresponds to input 4.

field.name: StopResourceSelection
field.description: Stop resource selection. Setting any of these bits to 1 selects the corresponding EmbeddedICE watchpoint input as a TraceEnable stop resource. Bit [16] corresponds to input 1, bit [17] corresponds to input 2, bit [18] corresponds to input 3, and bit [19] corresponds to input 4.

field.name: TraceID
field.description: Trace ID to output onto the trace bus. On an ETM reset this field is cleared to 0x00.

field.name: ETMpoweredup
field.description: The value of this bit indicates whether you can access the ETM Trace Registers. The value of this bit is always 1, indicating that the ETM Trace Registers can be accessed.

field.name: EXTIN
field.description: A read of these bits returns the value of the EXTIN[1:0] input pins.

field.name: COREHALT
field.description: A read of this bit returns the value of the COREHALT input pin.

field.name: TRIGGER
field.description: A write to this bit sets the TRIGGER output.

register.name: _ITATBCTR2
register.description: ETM Integration Test ATB Control 2 Register

field.name: ATREADY
field.description: A read of this bit returns the value of the ETM ATREADY input.

register.name: _ITATBCTR0
register.description: ETM Integration Test ATB Control 0 Register

field.name: ATVALID
field.description: A write to this bit sets the value of the ETM ATVALID output.

field.name: Mode
field.description: Enable integration mode. When this bit is set to 1, the device enters integration mode to enable Topology Detection or Integration Testing to be checked. On an ETM reset this bit is cleared to 0.

field.name: CLAIMSET
field.description: A bit programmable register bank which sets the Claim Tag Value. Write 1 to set the bit in the claim tag. A read will return a logic 1 for all implemented locations.

field.name: CLAIMCLR
field.description: A bit programmable register bank that is zero at reset. Write 1 to clear the bit in the claim tag. On reads, returns the current setting of the claim tag.

field.name: WriteAccessCode
field.description: Write Access Code. A write of 0xC5ACCE55 enables further write access to this device. An invalid write will have the affect of removing write access.

field.name: IMP
field.description: Lock mechanism is implemented. This bit always reads 1.

field.name: STATUS
field.description: Lock Status. This bit is HIGH when the device is locked, and LOW when unlocked.

enumeratedValue.name: STATUS_1
enumeratedValue.description: Write access to the component is blocked. All writes to control registers are ignored. Reads are permitted.

field.name: s8BIT
field.description: Access Lock Register size. This bit reads 0 to indicate a 32-bit register is present.

field.name: NSID
field.description: Reads as b00, Non-secure invasive debug not supported by the ETM.

field.name: SID
field.description: Reads as b00, Secure invasive debug not supported by the ETM.

enumeratedValue.name: ComponentClass_15
enumeratedValue.description: PrimeCell of system component with no standardized register layout, for backward compatibility.
